title: Select Treeview node from code
body: The TreeView (from Windows Update 1803) lacks the possibility to select a ceirtain TreeViewNode from code.

comments.body:
When are we gonna have this feature?
It's been 1 year already.
Thanks
sjb: will you be able to try out the TreeView included in the WinUI Library and let us know the exact issues you face with navigating the children/parent relationship?
A related problem is that one cannot easily navigate the children / parent relationship in code. It seems that the only way to do this is to search in the visual tree.
Awesome! can't wait for this to be added

In addition, the control seems to differentiate between the current highlighted node and a selected node.  I suspect this has more to do with different selection modes.  In any event, there should be a read/write property for the node that is highlighted.  The ItemInvoked event can be used for tracking the last node the user invoked, but there seems to be no way to select/invoke a new node programmatically.  The use case for this is if the state of the TreeView is programmatically restored for a given path.
